title: Can you solve the rogue submarine riddle? Difficulty level: Master - Alex Rosenthal

multiple-choice.question: **Knowledge**

options.label: A
options.text: The boss gave Minion A and Minion B two distinct positive integers with at least two elements, each less than 7.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: The boss gave Minion A and Minion B two distinct positive integers with at least two elements, each greater than 7.

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: **Comprehension**

options.label: A
options.text: Minion A and Minion B were given the sum and product of two distinct positive integers, respectively, with at least two elements less than 7.

options.label: B
options.text: Minion A and Minion B were given the sum and product of two distinct positive integers, but with at least one element greater than 7.

options.text: Minion A and Minion B were given the sum and product of two distinct positive integers, but with at least one element less than 7.

title: You could have a secret twin (but not the way you think) - Kayla Mandel Sheets

multiple-choice.question: What is the medical condition where an individual has two genomes present in the tissues of their body, as experienced by Karen Keegan?

options.label: A
options.text: Mosaicism

options.label: B
options.text: Chimerism

options.label: C
options.text: Genetic mutation

options.label: D
options.text: Cancer

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, how does chimerism occur in one of the most common forms?

options.label: A
options.text: Through a genetic mutation in the mother's egg

options.label: B
options.text: By a mother and fetus swapping cells in the flow of nutrients across the placenta

options.label: C
options.text: Through a tissue or organ transplant

options.label: D
options.text: By inheriting fetal stem cells from a previous pregnancy

multiple-choice.question: If a mother has chimerism, what is the likelihood that her children will also have the condition?

options.label: A
options.text: All of her children will have chimerism

options.label: B
options.text: Some of her children may have chimerism, but it depends on the specific circumstances

options.label: C
options.text: None of her children will have chimerism

options.label: D
options.text: It's impossible to predict

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the condition where an individual has two genomes present in the tissues of their body, and how does it relate to Greek mythology?

options.label: A
options.text: Chimerism is a condition where an individual has two genomes, and it's named after the Greek myth of the Chimera, a creature with the head of a lion, body of a goat, and tail of a serpent.

options.label: B
options.text: Chimerism is a condition where an individual has two genomes, and it's named after the Greek myth of the Hydra, a serpent-like creature.

options.label: C
options.text: Chimerism is a condition where an individual has two genomes, and it's named after the Greek myth of the Minotaur, a creature with the body of a man and the head of a bull.

options.label: D
options.text: Chimerism is a condition where an individual has two genomes, and it's named after the name comes from Greek mythology, where chimera is an amalgam of three different animals.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is the role of the immune system in chimerism?

options.label: A
options.text: The immune system recognizes and destroys cells with the second genome

options.label: B
options.text: The immune system suppresses the growth of cells with the second genome

options.label: C
options.text: The immune system has no role in chimerism

options.label: D
options.text: The immune system is suppressed during pregnancy, allowing fetal stem cells to persist in the mother's body

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the discovery that 10% of a father's sperm can carry a second genome from an embryonic twin?

options.label: A
options.text: It challenges our understanding of genetics and highlights the complexity of human biology

options.label: B
options.text: It has no significant impact on our understanding of genetics

options.label: C
options.text: It confirms that genetics is a simple and straightforward field of study

options.label: D
options.text: It suggests that chimerism is a rare condition that affects only a small percentage of the population

multiple-choice.question: What is the implication of the fact that 1 in 8 individual births started out as twin pregnancies?

options.label: A
options.text: There may be many more people with two genomes who are unaware of their condition

options.label: B
options.text: Chimerism is a rare condition that affects only a small percentage of the population

options.label: C
options.text: Genetics is a simple and straightforward field of study

options.label: D
options.text: Chimerism has no significant impact on human biology

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, how did Karen Keegan's liver regenerate itself?

options.label: A
options.text: Through a genetic mutation

options.label: B
options.text: By inheriting fetal stem cells from a previous pregnancy

options.label: C
options.text: Through a tissue or organ transplant

options.label: D
options.text: By a mother and fetus swapping cells in the flow of nutrients across the placenta

multiple-choice.question: What is the relationship between the presence of fetal stem cells and the development of chimerism?

options.label: A
options.text: Fetal stem cells are the cause of chimerism

options.label: B
options.text: Fetal stem cells are the result of chimerism

options.label: C
options.text: Fetal stem cells can persist in the mother's body and develop into chimerism

options.label: D
options.text: Fetal stem cells have no role in the development of chimerism

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is the significance of the fact that humans are all amalgams to some extent, carrying around the different genetic codes of our gut bacteria and even our mitochondria?

options.label: A
options.text: It highlights the complexity of human biology and the need for further research

options.label: B
options.text: It confirms that genetics is a simple and straightforward field of study

options.label: C
options.text: It suggests that chimerism is a rare condition that affects only a small percentage of the population

options.label: D
options.text: It has no significant impact on our understanding of genetics

title: Earth's mysterious red glow, explained - Zoe Pierrat

multiple-choice.question: What was the unexpected wavelength of unknown origin that researchers noticed when scanning Earth's surface in 2009?

options.label: A
options.text: A wavelength that is reflected sunlight

options.label: B
options.text: A wavelength that corresponds with densely populated areas

options.label: C
options.text: A wavelength that is emitted by human-made sources

options.label: D
options.text: A wavelength that never escapes the Sun's outer atmosphere

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary way that plants use light during photosynthesis?

options.label: A
options.text: By transforming it into heat and dissipating it out of their leaves

options.label: B
options.text: By radiating it back out at a different wavelength, producing chlorophyll fluorescence

options.label: C
options.text: By converting it into chemical energy, which powers the conversion of carbon dioxide and water into glucose

options.label: D
options.text: By storing it as chemical energy

multiple-choice.question: What is the byproduct of photosynthesis that is produced by plants, algae, and bacteria?

options.label: A
options.text: Glucose

options.label: B
options.text: Chlorophyll

options.label: C
options.text: Carbon dioxide

options.label: D
options.text: Oxygen

multiple-choice.question: What happens to excess light absorbed by plants during photosynthesis?

options.label: A
options.text: It is radiated back out at a different wavelength, producing chlorophyll fluorescence

options.label: B
options.text: It is stored as chemical energy

options.label: C
options.text: It is transformed into heat and dissipates out of their leaves

options.label: D
options.text: It is emitted as light at the red end of the spectrum

multiple-choice.question: What is the percentage of light absorbed by plants that is re-emitted as wavelengths at the red end of the spectrum?
What is the advantage of using chlorophyll fluorescence as a measure of plant health compared to tracking levels of greenness?

options.label: A
options.text: It is less expensive and easier to measure

options.label: B
options.text: It is more accurate and can detect changes in plant health over a longer period of time

options.label: C
options.text: It is more reliable and can detect changes in plant health before visible signs of stress

options.label: D
options.text: It is less sensitive to environmental factors

multiple-choice.question: What are some of the applications of tracking chlorophyll fluorescence from space?

options.label: A
options.text: Studying the behavior of phytoplankton blooms

options.label: B
options.text: Tracking the effects of climate change

options.label: C
options.text: Monitoring the health of ecosystems worldwide

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

multiple-choice.question: What is the benefit of using chlorophyll fluorescence to monitor plant health?

options.label: A
options.text: It can track the effects of drought on plant health

options.label: B
options.text: It can monitor the health of ecosystems worldwide

options.label: C
options.text: It can detect changes in plant health before visible signs of stress

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary purpose of the research on photosynthesis from space?

options.label: A
options.text: To study the behavior of phytoplankton blooms

options.label: B
options.text: To track the effects of climate change on plant health

options.label: C
options.text: To support the health of plants and ecosystems

options.label: D
options.text: To monitor the health of ecosystems worldwide

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the discovery of chlorophyll fluorescence from space?

options.label: A
options.text: It has led to a better understanding of the health of ecosystems worldwide

options.label: B
options.text: It has allowed for the tracking of the effects of climate change on plant health

options.label: C
options.text: It has enabled the monitoring of the health of plants and ecosystems in real-time
